video.title: Bizarre Foods with Andrew Zimmern Collection
video.synopsis: Andrew Zimmern steps out of his own comfort zone by giving us a taste of the world's different cultures as well as exotic foods in his own backyard.

episodes.synopsis: Andrew arrives in the star-studded city of Los Angeles, where the variety of food varies as much as the diversity of the people who live there.
episodes.title: Los Angeles

episodes.synopsis: According to experts, there's a connection between exotic foods and sex; so Andrew tests the theory with a feast served atop a nude model.
episodes.title: Sexy Food

episodes.synopsis: Andrew travels to Uganda and hunts for a fish that lives on land, harvests a meal made up of flying ants, and eats meat of a sugar cane rat.
episodes.title: Uganda

episodes.synopsis: Andrew travels to Seoul, South Korea, where he feasts on the country's most authentic soups, barbecues and fermented foods.
episodes.title: South Korea

episodes.synopsis: Andrew heads into the Australian Outback, where he eats wallaby, samples crocodile cooked on the barbie and makes a meal out of poisonous cane toads.
episodes.title: Outback

episodes.synopsis: The melting pot of Singapore culture is seen everywhere, including at the Hawker Stalls, where Andrew is left sucking on bones.
episodes.title: Singapore

episodes.synopsis: Andrew tours Texas, sampling some of the region's most outrageous creations. Then, it's off to the NASA kitchens for a behind-the-scenes tour.
episodes.title: Texas

episodes.synopsis: The people of Nicaragua are resilient and resourceful, and it shows in the food they eat. Andrew gets a taste of iguana eggs and boa constrictor.
episodes.title: Nicaragua

episodes.synopsis: Andrew samples the cuisine in Mongolia, where people live off the harsh land much in the same way their ancestors did in the days of Genghis Khan.
episodes.title: Mongolia

episodes.synopsis: From native traditions of the Navajo to the "new age" approach to food, Andrew uncovers unique food traditions in the great state of Arizona.
episodes.title: Arizona

episodes.synopsis: Andrew visits Bangkok, which he calls the most sensuous city on Earth, where he'll feast on ant larvae and even try the infamous "condom salad."
episodes.title: Bangkok

episodes.synopsis: From street carts to high-end cuisine in Tijuana, Ensenada and La Paz, Andrew samples the best the peninsula of Baja in Mexico has to offer.
episodes.title: Baja, Mexico

episodes.synopsis: Andrew's travels around the world have proven that when it comes to trying new foods, kids are some of most adventurous eaters around.
episodes.title: Kids' Special

episodes.synopsis: Andrew learns how diplomatic food can be when he tastes delicacies from Washington, D.C.'s foreign embassies, including octopus ceviche and guinea pig.
episodes.title: Embassy Row

episodes.synopsis: Ground camel kabobs, boiled goat and bean fool are a few traditional foods shared with Andrew on his visit to one of Earth's oldest civilizations.
episodes.title: Syria

episodes.synopsis: Andrew stays close to home and partakes of unusual taste treasures, including a fish's poisonous sex organs prepared by master chef Masaharu Morimoto.
episodes.title: Pennsylvania

episodes.synopsis: The flavors of past and present collide when Andrew feasts with a Romani family, chows down on a bull's private parts and fishes for fresh carp.
episodes.title: Hungary

episodes.synopsis: Andrew discovers that in Madagascar, hunting and gathering is still a tradition when preparing dishes made from wild zebu meat and baobab fruit.
episodes.title: Madagascar

episodes.synopsis: Intrepid food trekker Andrew travels deep into the heart of multicultural Montreal to feast on duck livers, horse-heart tartare and pork knuckles.
episodes.title: Montreal

episodes.synopsis: At the apex of all things spicy, Andrew tests his temperature tolerance for tasting pig brains in chili oil and a dish called "heart attack noodles."
episodes.title: Chengdu

episodes.synopsis: Andrew heads home to meet up with fellow food lover Anthony Bourdain, talk about travel and sample lobster burata, octopus fusili and bone marrow.
episodes.title: NYC: Will Work for Food

episodes.synopsis: Deep in the rainforest, Andrew happens upon exotic creatures to look at and to eat, including fresh lizard and roast pingo snout on a stick.
episodes.title: Suriname

episodes.synopsis: Andrew samples Moroccan taste treats straight from the Middle Ages, including camel ribs, lamb's testicles and a traditional dish of pigeon pie.
episodes.title: Fez, Morocco

episodes.synopsis: Strange and exotic delicacies await Andrew's tastebuds in this tropical paradise, including cobra's blood, water buffalo entrails and a Balinese feast.
episodes.title: Indonesia

episodes.synopsis: A delicious melting pot of people, cultures and flavors awaits Andrew as he visits and samples foods from Cuba, Belize, Puerto Rico and Florida.
episodes.title: Taste of the Tropics
